topic.title: PT9.1.09 Updating a Project with a new version of the Base Plan

body.p: Project plans can be modified as needed. But occasionally the base plan upon which that project plan has been built will be modified. What happens if the base plan has been updated?
There are two ways to update the base plan.

ul.li: Choose Project Settings then Project plan.
A warning is displayed that there is a new version of the plan and you can migrate.
Click the link Migrate to a new version of the project plan.
Keep the tasks that are not in the new version,
Remove all the tasks that are not in the new version,

body.p: Paratext warns that you must do a send/receive, click OK to clear the message

ul.li:
A green message bar at the top gives you three options:
Close [XMLmind] message
View progress in the previous plan,
Undo the base Plan update.

body.p: Note the version number has been updated.
If the base plan has been updated, then a message will appear showing that you can update.

ul.li: Click on Update to [XMLmind] version of project plan.
Choose to keep or remove the tasks.
When you update it will do a send receive.
Choose an option to view progress

body.p: So if a base plan has been updated then the administrator can update the project plan based on that updated base plan.
